channel.title: Barcampbangkok on Sajal Kayan
channel.description: Recent content in Barcampbangkok on Sajal Kayan

item.title: BarCampBangkok winter 2008 a HUGE success!
item.description: Last Saturday was BarCampBangkok. It was the first BarCamp in Thailand and was hosted at Indus Restaurant. The day was January 26th and co-incided with India's 59th Republic Day and an education exhibition at Queen Sirikit National Convention Center. Thaindian.com was the Web Partner for the education exhibition and we had 2 booths there, thus my presence there especially during the opening ceremony was important. After the opening of the exhibition and getting someone to cover for me, at about 11am I headed to BarCamp. As soon as i stepped into the garden I was amazed to see so many happy campers. Registered and got my tag. In case anyone is wondering my tags were "Drupal, SEO, SEM and monetizing". Most of my time there I spend interacting with some of the other campers. Did an occasional errand or two. When I entered most of the presentations were either topics I am not interested in or were in Thai language. The ones I was interested in were scheduled after lunch. I was thinking about talking about my journey from Joomla to Drupal, but I had no time(or energy) to prepare anything. After the delicious lunch, I attended jfxbern's presentation on Drupal App Development with CCK and Views. Unfortunately mid-way during the session his Firefox crashed (it was running on Windoze after all!). The good side was I won a cool Google shirt. At about 3pm, I left back for Queen Sirikit National Convention center to attend to my booth and take some more pics of the exhibition.Joined back for the afterparty at about 6:30pm. The after-party was fun, so many campers in a nice lil place on Sukhumvit Soi 33/1. Here I was one of the last few people standing.. Next day woke up at 8am to attend to my booths. BarCampBangkok 2.0 is most likely to be BeachCamp, really looking forward to it. Perhaps use a long weekend and extend it into a 2/3 day event.

item.title: The best T-Shirt Award Goes to....
item.description: At Flickr Anoop an ajarn from Chulalongkorn University. UPDATE : OMG! Showed this post to a (non-Geek/non-Tech/vista user) friend and even he understood it, bursted out laughing!

item.title: BarCampBangkok's potential achievements?
item.description:
NOTE: Totally based on assumptions. Please comment to add more or remove/rectify false ones. BarCamp is an international network of user-generated conferences — open, participatory workshop-events, whose content is provided by participants — often focusing on early-stage web applications, and related open source technologies, social protocols, and open data formats. The event will be bilingual, in both English and Thai. January 26th, 2008 at Indus Restaurant, Bangkok BarCampBangkok Achievements :-
  • The first BarCamp in Thailand
  • The largest BarCamp in Asia - Expecting 200 participants.
  • The first BarCamp in Asia to be conducted at a restaurant.
  • The first BarCamp conducted in an Indian Restaurant.
  • 100% Sponsored - Participants do not pay if they don't wish to do so and go home with a free cool shirt.
  • Organized by the coolest people.
  • First item on Google News Search.
  • 177 people registered within 4 days!
